Operators-操作符

” Unary Operators-一元操作符 ” Page 44

  • ” Increment/Decrement ” Page 44
    • ++
    • --
  • ” Unary Plus and Minus ” Page 46
    • Perfom similar to Number()

” Bitwise Operators-位操作符 ” Page 48

  • ” Bitwise NOT-按位非 ” Page 49
    • ~
  • ” Bitwise AND-按位与 ” Page 50
    • &
  • ” Bitwise OR-按位或” Page 50
    • |
  • ” Bitwise XOR-按位异或 ” Page 51
    • ^
  • ” Left Shift ” Page 52
    • <<
  • ” Signed Right Shift-有符号右移” Page 52
    • >>
  • ” Unsigned Right Shift-无符号右移 ” Page 52
    • >>>

” Boolean Operators-布尔操作符 ” Page 53

    • ” Logical NOT ” Page 53

      • !
      • !!

    • ” Logical AND ” Page 54

      • &&

    • ” Logical OR ” Page 55

      • ||

” Multiplicative Operators-乘性操作符 ” Page 56

  • ” Multiply ” Page 56
    • *
  • ” Divide ” Page 57
    • /
  • ” Modulus/ Remainder Operator ” Page 58
    • %

” Additive Operators-加性操作符” Page 58

  • ” Add ” Page 59
    • +
    • Able to combine string
  • ” Subtract ” Page 60
    • -

” Exponentiation Operator-指数操作符” Page 58

  • console.log(Math.pow(3, 2); // 9 console.log(3 ** 2); // 9

” Relational Operators-关系操作符” Page 61

” Equality Operators-相等操作符” Page 62

  • ” Equal and Not Equal ” Page 62
    • Compare after conversion
  • ” Identically Equal and Not Identically Equal ” Page 63
    • Compare without coercion
    • identically equal Page 63
      • === Page 63
    • not identically equal Page 64
      • !== Page 64
  • it is recommended to use identically equal and not identically equal instead. Page 64

” Assignment Operators-赋值操作符” Page 64

  • Simple assignment is done with the equal sign (=) Page 64
    • assigns the value on the right to the variable on the left Page 64
  • Compound-assignment operators Page 65
    • Multiply/assign (*=) Page 65
    • Divide/assign (/=) Page 65
    • Modulus/assign (%=) Page 65
    • Add/assign (+=) Page 65
    • Subtract/assign (-=) Page 65
    • Left shift/assign (../<=) Page 65
    • Signed right shift/assign (>>=) Page 65
    • Unsigned right shift/assign (>>>=) Page 65

” Conditional Operator-条件操作符” Page 64

  • Short Circuiting
    • let max = (num1 > num2) ? num1 : num2;

” Comma Operator-逗号操作符 ” Page 65

  • is used in the declaration of variables
    • let num1 = 1, num2 = 2, num3 = 3;
  • can also be used to assign values
    • let num = (5, 1, 4, 8, 0); // num becomes 0
    • the comma operator always returns the last item in the expression
